ej.wadapps.admin

Interface ApplicationsManager


  • public interface ApplicationsManager
    The applications manager is responsible of the applications lifecycle.

    It allows:

    • to install applications,
    • retrieve applications information.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(InputStream commandInputStream)
      throws IOException,
             ApplicationOperationException,
             UnsupportedOperationException,
             SecurityException
        Decodes and executes an application management command. For example, the command can be a request to install, uninstall, start, stop an application…

        The format of the command binary form is not specified here and depend on the implementation.

        For example, the command could be digitally signed and encoded using Distinguished Encoding Rules, a.k.a DER, (see ASN.1).

        Parameters:
        commandInputStream - the encoded command input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        ApplicationOperationException - if an error occurs while executing the command.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the applications manager does not support the operation.
        SecurityException - if a security manager exits and if the caller does not have the appropriate permissions.

      • execute

        void execute(InputStream commandInputStream,
             IProgressMonitor monitor)
      throws IOException,
             ApplicationOperationException,
             UnsupportedOperationException,
             SecurityException
        Decodes and executes an application management command. For example, the command can be a request to install, uninstall, start, stop an application…

        The format of the command binary form is not specified here and depend on the implementation.

        For example, the command could be digitally signed and encoded using Distinguished Encoding Rules, a.k.a DER, (see ASN.1).

        Parameters:
        commandInputStream - the encoded command input stream.
        monitor - the progress monitor to use for reporting progress to the user. It is the caller's responsibility to call done() on the given monitor. Accepts null, indicating that no progress should be reported and that the operation cannot be cancelled.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        ApplicationOperationException - if an error occurs while executing the command.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the applications manager does not support the operation.
        SecurityException - if a security manager exits and if the caller does not have the appropriate permissions.

      • install

        Application install(InputStream inputStream,
                    String applicationIdentifier,
                    String applicationVersion)
             throws IOException,
                    ApplicationOperationException,
                    UnsupportedOperationException,
                    SecurityException
        Installs an application from the given input stream.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the input stream from where the application data is loaded.
        applicationIdentifier - the application identifier.
        applicationVersion - the application version.
        Returns:
        the newly installed application.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        ApplicationOperationException - if an error occurs during the installation or if unsigned applications are not authorized.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the applications manager cannot install applications.
        SecurityException - if a security manager exits and if the caller does not have the appropriate permissions.

      • addApplicationLifecycleListener

        void addApplicationLifecycleListener(ApplicationLifecycleListener applicationLifecycleListener)
                              throws NullPointerException
        Adds an application lifecycle listener.

        It will be notified for each application event: install, start, stop, uninstall.

        Parameters:
        applicationLifecycleListener - the listener to add.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given listener is null.

      • removeApplicationLifecycleListener

        void removeApplicationLifecycleListener(ApplicationLifecycleListener applicationLifecycleListener)
        Removes an application lifecycle listener.

        If the given listener is null or not registered, nothing is done.

        Parameters:
        applicationLifecycleListener - the listener to remove.

      • getInstalledApplications

        Application[] getInstalledApplications()
        Gets all installed applications.

        If there is not installed applications, this method returns an empty array.

        Returns:
        all installed applications.

      • getCurrentApplication

        Application getCurrentApplication()
        Gets the context application.
        Returns:
        the context application.

      • getApplication

        Application getApplication(Object object)
        Gets the application that owns the given object.
        Parameters:
        object - the object.
        Returns:
        the application that owns this object or null if the application has been stopped
